statements.sql: select `tags`.*, (select count(*) from `posts` inner join `post_tags` on `posts`.`id` = `post_tags`.`post_id` where `tags`.`id` = `post_tags`.`tag_id`) as `posts_count` from `tags` where exists (select * from `posts` inner join `post_tags` on `posts`.`id` = `post_tags`.`post_id` where `tags`.`id` = `post_tags`.`tag_id` and `post_id` = 2) order by `posts_count` desc

statements.sql: select `posts`.*, `post_tags`.`tag_id` as `pivot_tag_id`, `post_tags`.`post_id` as `pivot_post_id` from `posts` inner join `post_tags` on `posts`.`id` = `post_tags`.`post_id` where `post_tags`.`tag_id` in (1, 2, 4, 8)
hints: Use SELECT * only if you need all columns from table

statements.sql: select `post_categories`.*, (select count(*) from `posts` where `post_categories`.`id` = `posts`.`post_category_id`) as `posts_count` from `post_categories` order by `priority` asc
